## NFormatOptions interface

Options for formatting a number with nFormat.

**Signature:**

```typescript
interface NFormatOptions 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [fractionalDigits?](./bitburner.nformatoptions.fractionaldigits.md) |  | number | _(Optional)_ Defines how many digits to show in the fractional part of the decimal. Defaults to 3. For integers, this is ignored until the value is suffixed. |
|  [specialFlag?](./bitburner.nformatoptions.specialflag.md) |  | [NFormatSpecialFlag](./bitburner.nformatspecialflag.md) | <p>_(Optional)_ Defines special behavior for nFormat. For normal formatting, do not include a special flag.</p><p>"integer": Formats the number as an integer. The specified fractionalDigits will only be applied if the number is large enough for a suffix. This is how e.g. skills or hp are displayed ingame.</p><p>"percent": Formats the number as a percent. Never collapses to a suffixed form (treats suffixStart as Infinity)</p><p>"ram": Formats the number as an amount of ram. Ram is always suffixed (treats suffixStart as 0).</p> |
|  [suffixStart?](./bitburner.nformatoptions.suffixstart.md) |  | number | _(Optional)_ How large the number has to be before it will collapse into a suffixed form. If not provided, defaults to 1000. Always treated as 0 for ram formatting. |
